Items.Title: Oversight - New York City’s Bus System (Network, Operations, Equity, and Redesign).
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - New York City’s Bus System (Network, Operations, Equity, and Redesign).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the issuance of multiple bus lane violation tickets for the same infraction within a one hour period
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the issuance of multiple bus lane violation tickets for the same infraction within a one hour period.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to bus lane restrictions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Bus lane restrictions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing notice to home and business owners regarding the creation or removal of bus stops
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Providing notice to home and business owners regarding new bus stops.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (“MTA”) to adjust schedules for distant subway terminal lines to include more peak-direction rush hour trains for commuters to travel to central economic hubs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: MTA to adjust schedules for distant subway terminal lines to include more peak-direction rush hour trains for commuters to travel to central economic hubs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to remediate any transportation structure, primarily elevated train lines, with extremely high levels of lead.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: MTA to remediate any transportation structure, primarily elevated train lines, with extremely high levels of lead.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the New York State Governor to sign, legislation, which would create unlimited transfers within the two-hour period of paying the Metropolitan Transportation Authority subway or bus fare for pay-per-ride users.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Create unlimited transfers within the two-hour period of paying the Metropolitan Transportation Authority subway or bus fare for pay-per-ride users.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to conduct longitudinal studies on the environmental, economic, and social impacts of congestion pricing throughout New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: MTA to conduct longitudinal studies on the environmental, economic, and social impacts of congestion pricing throughout New York City.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the New York State Governor to sign, S.3887A/A.7316A, requiring that any individual who is eligible for the Fair Fares NYC program and any person whose income is 200 percent of the federal poverty level receive a 50 percent discount on trips using the Long Island Rail Road, paratransit services, New York City Transit subways or buses, and the Metro-North Railroad.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring that any individual who is eligible for the Fair Fares NYC program and any person whose income is 200 percent of the federal poverty level receive a 50 percent discount on trips (S.3887A/A.7316A).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would require the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to provide free express bus fare to New York City students who take express buses to and from school.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Require the MTA to provide free express bus fare to NYC students who take express buses to and from school.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) to create a program that provides New York City’s first responder agencies with real-time Global Positioning System (GPS) data for all MTA buses.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: MTA to create a program that provides New York City’s first responder agencies with real-time GPS data for all MTA buses.

Items.Title: Roll Call
Oversight - New York City’s Bus System (Network, Operations, Equity, and Redesign).
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - New York City’s Bus System (Network, Operations, Equity, and Redesign).
